page.title: 06FARMING IN HENLLAN (2)
page.content: The dairy herds average 45 in number, mainly British Friesians.The quality of the herds has been improved by using the A.I. services from pedigree bulls at the Milk Marketing Board centre near Ruthin.Because of the small local population the milk is marketed at the COOP creamery at Llan- dyrnog where it is processed into cheese.The method of collection has changed in recent years from churn to bulk tanker. Store and fat cattle are also reared. The calves are usually Friesian cross bred with Charolais and Limousin as well as the traditional Herefords. Store cattle are sold at markets in Abergele and Ruthin whilst fat cattle in the local Denbigh market.Some are also slaughtered in the local abbatoir in Henllan.
